texts.value: Mediates transport of gamma-aminobutyric acid (GABA) together with sodium and chloride and is responsible for the reuptake of GABA from the synapse (PubMed:18054861, PubMed:1975955). The translocation of GABA, however, may also occur in the reverse direction leading to the release of GABA (PubMed:18054861, PubMed:21775701). The direction and magnitude of GABA transport is a consequence of the prevailing thermodynamic conditions, determined by membrane potential and the intracellular and extracellular concentrations of Na(+), Cl(-) and GABA (PubMed:18054861, PubMed:21775701). Also mediates sodium- and chloride-dependent transport of hypotaurine (By similarity)

reaction.name: hypotaurine(out) + chloride(out) + 2 Na(+)(out) = hypotaurine(in) + chloride(in) + 2 Na(+)(in)

texts.value: Inhibited by nipecotic acid, cis-3-aminocyclohexane carboxylic acid and 2,4-diaminobutyric acid
Interacts (via PDZ domain-binding motif) with PALS1; interaction increases SLC6A1-mediated GABA uptake
Localized at the presynaptic terminals of interneurons
This protein is the target of psychomotor stimulants such as amphetamines or cocaine
Belongs to the sodium:neurotransmitter symporter (SNF) (TC 2.A.22) family. SLC6A1 subfamily
